question: 限度
sourceMnemonic:
A certain <kanji>limit</kanji>’s <kanji>degree</kanji> is how far it can go. It’s the <vocabulary>limit</vocabulary>; turn it up one more degree and it’s out of <vocabulary>bounds</vocabulary>. Keep it right where it is and it’s perfect.

This word refers to the maximum extent or range of something, beyond which it cannot be surpassed. While similar to <ja>限界</ja>, <ja>限度</ja> often implies a predetermined acceptable or tolerable limit, while <ja>限界</ja> is more closely associated with an absolute or ultimate limit.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
